bcid
Class encoderShoulder

java.lang.Object
  bcid.encoderDataset
All Implemented Interfaces:
encoder
Direct Known Subclasses:
minterShoulder
public class encoderShoulder
extends java.lang.Object
implements encoder

The purpsose of this is to encode very short identifiers for EZID shoulders to represent unique datasets. These encoded numbers correspond to integers in the database and conform to the EZID shoulder specification, namely letters up to and including the first digit. E.g. aB1 or abcdefg1

The system here uses successive combinations of 51 letters (ommitting O) plus a spot for a digit at the end, currently only encoding the digit "2" If we have 3 letters in the shoulder including 1 digit this gives 1,217,727 possible permutations. 4 letters and 1 digit will give 74,549,800 possible permutations.
